sn2.5:1.2: Then, when the night had advanced, the young deva Dāmali, of stunning beauty, illuminating the entire Jeta’s Grove, approached the Blessed One.
sn2.5:1.3: Having approached, he paid homage to the Blessed One, stood to one side, and recited this verse in the presence of the Blessed One:
sn2.5:2.1: “This should be done by the brahmin:
sn2.5:2.3: That by his abandoning of sensual desires
sn2.5:2.4: He does not yearn for existence. ”
sn2.5:3.1: “For the brahmin there is no task to be done,
sn2.5:3.3: “For the brahmin has done what should be done.
sn2.5:3.4: While he has not gained a footing in the river,
sn2.5:3.5: A man will strain with all his limbs;
sn2.5:3.6: But a footing gained, standing on the ground,
sn2.5:3.7: He need not strain for he has gone beyond.
sn2.5:4.1: “This is a simile for the brahmin, O Dāmali,
sn2.5:4.2: For the taintless one, the discreet meditator.
sn2.5:4.3: Having reached the end of birth and death,
sn2.5:4.4: He need not strain for he has gone beyond. ”
